description: Construction of a part double-height and part three storey industrial building for use as warehousing with ancillary offices (B8 use class) and 3 no. warehouse units (B8 use class); retention of two-storey rear extension to building; and alteration of vehicle crossovers on Sarsfield Road involving the widening of one crossover, the reinstatement of one crossover and the installation of a vehicle crossover (1,568sqm total redeveloped floor space comprising 637sqm additional warehouse floor area and 931sqm ancillary office space).
decision_conditions: Timing:
The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| Approved Plans:
The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:

5460/P5-001(location plan); 5460/E0-001 (site plan existing); 5460/P5-300 (south and west elevations existing); 5460/P5-02 Rev B (site layout and vehicle tracking); 5460/P5-100 (ground floor plan proposed); 5460/P5-101 (1st floor plan proposed); 5460/P5-102_A (2nd floor plan proposed); 5460/P5-006_A (roof plan proposed); 5460/P5-300_A (south and west elevations proposed); 5460/P5-301_A (north and east elevations proposed); 5460/P5-200 (sections A-A/B-B); 5460/P5-201_A (sections C-C/D-D); 5460/P5-004 (existing/proposed overlay); 5460/P5-701 (Tree protection diagrams); Design and Access Statement prepared by Churchill Hui (dated 23/08/2014); Environmental Noise Report prepared by Sharps Redmore (dated 9th October 2014); Framework Travel Plan prepared by TTP Consulting (revised and dated October 2015); Energy Statement prepared by EAL Consult (dated March 2015); BRUKL Output Documents; and BREEAM UK New Construction 2014 Pre-Assessment dated 18th July 2014.
REASON: 	For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| Sustainable Urban Drainage Strategy:

Prior to commencement of the proposed development (excluding demolition and site clearance) (a) a completed Ealing Council SUDS form and detailed drainage design should be submitted and approved to demonstrate that the development would utilise sustainable urban drainage strategies in line with the Mayor's drainage hierarchy (b) A routine maintenance schedule should be submitted to demonstrate that the proposed surface water management methods will be suitably managed for the lifetime of the development to ensure that there will be no surface water flooding to or from the site up to and including a 1 in 100 year (plus climate change) rainfall event

REASON: 	To prevent flooding elsewhere by ensuring that sufficient storage of surface flood water is provided and achieved with appropriate sustainable drainage techniques, in accordance policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012); policy LV 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 5.12 and 5.13 of the London Plan (2015); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| External Surface Materials:

Notwithstanding any indications shown on the approved drawings samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted and approved before any part of the development is commenced (excluding demolition and site clearance). The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained thereafter.

REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surroundings, in accordance with policies 7B and Policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015).
| Intrusive Contaminated Land Investigation and Remediation Scheme:
Prior to the commencement of any works on site (except demolition and site clearance) the following shall be submitted to and subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority:

(a)	An intrusive contaminated land investigation and risk assessment of the site. This shall be carried out in accordance with BS1075:2011+A1:2013 and CR11 guidance to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site. This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person, and shall assess any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site.

(b)	A remediation (de-contamination) scheme to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended end use. It shall include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures.  The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.
Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation (de-contamination) scheme part (b)

(c) A verification report that demonstrates the completion of measures identified in the approved contamination remediation scheme shall be produced. The report shall be compiled in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.

REASON: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in accordance policy 5.21 of The London Plan, policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and the National Planning Policy Framework.
| Insulation of building envelope to prevent breakout noise:

The composite sound reduction index, Rw, for the building envelope of the proposed development with windows and doors closed and other means of ventilation provided, shall ensure that the rating noise level at sensitive facades, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, will not exceed the existing background noise level during the relevant period of operation. This insulation shall be implemented before the development is occupied and retained permanently thereafter.

REASON: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
| Noise Barrier:

Prior to commencement of the development (except demolition and site clearance) details of a noise barrier along the site boundary with adjacent residential properties shall be submitted for approval.  Barriers shall be constructed to the London Borough of Ealing specifications. The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.

REASON: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
| Energy & Sustainability:

The approved development shall incorporate measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 35% beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy Strategy prepared by EAL Consult (23 March 2015) and EH Solar PV  ASHP Info Required (emailed in 15 July 2015) including:
a)	energy saving measures to achieve at least 3.4% savings in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions beyond the complaint Building Regulations Part L 2013 base case;

b)	the incorporation of 26kWp/170.78sq.m solar PV and 2x45kW ASHP renewable technology to achieve at least 34.14% and equal to 10.30 tonnes CO2 / annum) in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions beyond the 'Be Lean' stage.

Within 3 months from the date of first occupation, evidence that the solar PV and ASHP technologies are certified by the Microgeneration Certification Scheme and Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's]/ Display Energy Certificates (DEC's) and Accompany Advisory Reports for the development and modelling output reports from the "as built stage" to confirm that the technologies chosen are renewable and compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures should be also submitted for written approval by the Local Authority.

REASON: To secure the measures set out within the approved Energy Statement and to ensure that the energy efficiency measures to be incorporated into the approved development contribute to reducing the use of fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity, and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2015, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
| BREEAM/Sustainability:
The approved development shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Building Research Establishment BREEAM overall Very Good standard (based on the latest BREEAM Technical Guidance).
Within three months of the commencement of the development, the following should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval:
1.         Evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the BREEAM New Construction Scheme
2.         Interim BREEAM NC Assessment and Certificate.

Within 3 months from the date of first occupation, the following should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming the BREEAM standard and measures have been implemented:
1.         BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' Assessment and Certificates verified by the BRE

Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the relevant part of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM 'Very Good' standard shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.

REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2015, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012.
| Noise from External Plant:

The rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

REASON: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
| No Works in External Areas:
No operational works (excluding vehicle movements) shall be carried out within the external areas of the site outside of the hours of operation.

REASON: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
| Regulation of Hours:
The hours of business use of the building shall be restricted to the period [0700 - 1900hrs] Monday to Saturday.

REASON: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
| Collections and Deliveries Hours:

Deliveries of goods to and waste collections from the proposed development shall only take place during the period 0800 - 1800 hrs on Mondays to Saturdays and at no time on Sundays and Public Holidays.

REASON: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
| Vehicle Parking Arrangements:

The vehicle parking arrangements shown on approved plan 5460/P5-02 Rev B shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose. No additional car parking shall be formed or made available except with the prior permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

REASON: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision within the site and to ensure that excessive parking is not provided, in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (FALP 2015); and section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Cycle Parking:

Sheltered and secure cycle parking for at least 10 cycles as indicated on approved plan 5460/P5-02 Rev B shall be in place prior to first occupation of the development hereby permitted and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for cycle parking.

REASON: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (FALP 2015); policies 1.1(k) and (g) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 (2012); and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG.
| Refuse and Recycling Storage:
Refuse and Recycling storage in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority, shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the development and retained thereafter.

REASON:  To ensure that suitable refuse storage facilities are provided and in the interests of the visual and general amenities of the area, in accordance with policy 5.16 of the London Plan (FALP 2015).
| Tree Protection:

All existing trees are to be retained as shown on drawing 5460/P5-02 Rev B (notwithstanding any indication otherwise shown on other approved drawings). These trees shall not be lopped, felled or otherwise affected in any way (including raising or lowering soil levels under the crown spread of the trees) and no excavation shall be cut under the crown spread of the trees. Protection of the trees shall be carried out only in accordance with British Standard 5837:2005 'Trees In Relation To Construction Recommendations' (or any subsequent revision), and shall be maintained fully intact and (in the case of the fencing) at all times, until the completion of all building operations on the site.

REASON:  In order to safeguard trees in the interests of the visual amenity of the area in accordance with sections 11 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework; policies 7.4 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015); policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Development Strategy DPD (2012); policy LV 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'.
| Temporary Use of Office Building:

Notwithstanding any indication otherwise shown on the approved plans the two storey building located in the north-west corner of the site shall be restored to its former lawful use (B8 use class) within three months of occupation of the approved ancillary offices.

Reason: The Local Planning Authority seeks to maintain strict control over the use of the site  in the interests of protecting strategic industrial land, in accordance with policies 1.1(b), 1.1(c) , 1.2(b) and 3.2(b) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) and policies 4.4 and 2.17 of the London Plan (2015).
| Permitted Development Rights:

Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), the development shall only be used for a B8 use class and not for any other use.

REASON: To accord with the terms of the application and to protect the strategic industrial status of this Preferred Industrial Location, in accordance with policy 1.2(b) of the Ealing Core Strategy; and policy 2.17 of the London Plan (FALP 2015).
